properties.name: Abert Rim with a Borrowed Dog and a Borrowed Truck
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05I was exploring eastern Oregon over spring break with an ex\'s truck and a friend\'s dog. No better way to travel, really.

properties.name: Ashland Dog Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  Ashland Dog ParkA lovely fenced dog park with shade trees, a shelter, picnic tables, pooper scoopers, a small dog area and a big tub for dogs to splash around in. At the bottom of the park is a gate and short trail to Bear Creek for more cooling off.

properties.name: Ashland Food Cooperative
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05   237 N. First St. Ashland ORThe best food coop/ health food store ever. Great salad/burrito bar, bulk food, health and beauty, books, gifts, produce, cheese, etc. etc. A fun, friendly place to meet in the Railroad District.

properties.name: Cape Cod Bay, Brewster
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05This was in January of 2004 after a couple weeks of freezing weather. We had spent the day brush cutting in the driving snow and walked out to the bay at the end of our work day. My friends back home who saw this picture asked "where were you? Antarctica??"

properties.name: Churchill Building, SOU
properties.description: Posted by Alyss051250 Siskiyou Blvd, Ashland, ORThe oldest building on the SOU campus. Just walk past, it\'s only administration offices now. It remains, however, the emblem of the college.

properties.name: Fairy Ponds
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05Follow granite street to past the reservoir on your left. A road goes off to the left, the road curves sharply to the right. You\'ll probably see cars parked straight ahead. Follow a trail up on the right side of the creek and keep and eye out for little swimming holes. Sometimes theres too much water, sometimes not enough. Sometimes too many people, sometimes you have the place to yourself. Look for Ouzels!

properties.name: Forest Park - NW Thurman St
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  Forest Park is the largest forested area within a city limits in the US and I am always looking for new ways to access it. This is a really popular entrance that leads onto the Leif Ericson drive. People with strollers, dogs and runners all use this road, but there are nice trails going off it.

properties.name: Gabriel Park - summer dog park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  My neighborhood park of choice. The park itself is huge and it has trails through open fields and forest area. The summer dog park is at the 45th entrance and is fenced, huge, grassy and busy. Look for the winter dog park during the wet months.

properties.name: Gabriel Park - winter dog park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  The winter dog park is in the part of the park called Little Gabriel. It is sanded to protect streams from doggy run off making for an interesting experience. On dry days everyone comes home with sand in their hair. It is smaller than the summer dog park so on nice weekends it can get a little crowded. Easy access to the walking trails in the park though, but watch the little leaguers in the spring.

properties.name: House of Thai
properties.description: Posted by Alyss051667 Siskiyou Blvd, Ashland ORFrom skipping dinner in the dorms and my first introduction to Thai Yellow Curry to believing the koi will eat me and "the Sexual Sunrise Weekend" fiasco, this is my favorite restaurant in Ashland. I have had plenty more Thai food and still think House of Thai is one of the best. Get the yellow curry and the sweet and sour, and don\'t get eaten by the fish.

properties.name: Irrigation Trail, Park Street
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 Irrigation Trail, Park StreetThis trail runs along the Talent Irrigation District canal all through the south hills of Ashland. Park street is one of many access points. The trail is quite flat and dirt that is a bit dusty in the summer, muddy in the winter. The water can be gross in the summer as well but there are lovely views of the hills, gardens and birds. The trail is not always contiguous due to private land owners restricting access, but from this point you can get a good walk in to the west.

properties.name: La Calaca Comelona
properties.description: Posted by Alyss052304 Se Belmont St, Portland, ORAuthentic mexican food - no burritos found here. Lots of funky art and pretty decent food. Do try the spicy drink on the menu and don\'t get that weird sausage hash thing. I stopped here for tequila once with a large New Yorker and had a good ole time.

properties.name: Lithia Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  A huge park in downtown Ashland. There is a duck pond right here and the park continues quite a way up the canyon. Explore up the creek for a playground, another duckpond, a bandshell, a japanese garden and a reservoir that is a swimming hole in the summer!

properties.name: Marquam Nature Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  From the entrance on Sam Jackson Rd you can hike up a canyon, loop around another or follow the trails all the way up to Council Crest. Because the trails are down in the canyon you really feel like you are out in the woods, but its really just the West Hills! The trails connect all through here and you can hike for miles if you have the stamina. One of the connections is the 40 mile loop trail that circumnavigates Portland.

properties.name: My old house
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 1260 Iowa St, Ashland OROn the corner of Ashland and Garfield. I loved this house. Neat neighborhood too. Very Ashlandy.

properties.name: Oredson Todd Woods Access
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05This parking spot connects you to the all weather trail in Oredson Todd woods and eventually to the White Rabbit and other trails in the Ashland Watershed.

properties.name: Pilaf Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 18 Guanajuato Way, Ashland ORA great restaurant that is the perfect blend of middle eastern and hippy food. Very tasty, can be reasonably priced. Try the Polenta Fries!

properties.name: Powell Butte Nature Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 This park is very popular with hikers, dog walkers and in the dry months bikers and horseback riders. I love going here on clear days because from the top you can see the mountains loud and clear. Trails range from paved to rutted, from open meadow to deep Douglas fir woods. Check the map at the parking lot. Be sure to have a leash with you because the rangers do patrol.

properties.name: Rogue Creamery
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05311 N Front Street, Central Point, ORCheese from Oregon, what could be better. They are best known for their award winning Oregonzola, but everything they make is lovely.

properties.name: SOU Student Union
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05The Student Union.. boring in the summer, but during the school year it is the center of campus. Read the crazy bulletin board for happenings in town, eat at the hippy food bar in the cafeteria, pay way too much for books at the bookstore. You know how student unions are.

properties.name: Sellwood Waterfront Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  An offleash area with river access for kids and dogs. Not an offleash area during the middle of the day on weekends. Totally worth a stop if your pup likes to swim.

properties.name: Senior Sam's Burrito
properties.description: Posted by Alyss051634 Ashland St, Ashland ORCafeteria style mexican food that rocks. Not too spicy, not too fancy, just a huge burrito for not too many clams. Get a Jr. Big unless you are a BIG eater.

properties.name: Smith Rocks State Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  These pictures were taken in December, not prime climbing season but still beautiful. I have since climbed there and spotted such crazy wildlife as naked hippies and coyotes.

properties.name: St Luke's Hospital San Fran
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 3555 Army Street, San Francisco CAAn early morning Sept 5 1980.. yeah, it was a good day.

properties.name: Sunset Bay State Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05   A beautiful beach with camping, a creek, tidepooling, hiking.. pretty much everything you could hope for from an Oregon coast beach. On the same road is Cape Arago which has more beaches, sea lions and a weird botanical garden. Lovely.

properties.name: Terwilliger Trail Access
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 The trail goes off from the west side of Terwilliger Blvd and is pretty clearly marked with a green Marquam Trail/40 mile loop sign. This trail goes up through the woods to meet up with the Maquam Nature park trails at Marquam Hill Road. Parking is in the pull outs along Terwilliger.

properties.name: The Amanda Pfisterer Fortress of Aaaaarrrrtttt
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 The Amanda Pfisterer Fortress of AaaarrrrtttAlright, it\'s actually called the Center for Visual Art, but when I started at SOU with Amanda Pfisterer the building was under construction and truly looked like a fortress. Since Amanda was an art major, it was clear they were building her a fortress of aaaaarrtt. Anyway... there is usually some sort of art display in the halls of these buildings, the museum is often interesting and the courtyard is a lovely place to sit and look at Grizzley Peak.

properties.name: The New Hannon Library, SOU
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 Despite the inconvience of the renovation, the library really is amazing. Check your email, drink some coffee, read a magazine, look at the mountains. It really is nice.

properties.name: Toothpick Trail
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  Toothpick TrailA wonderful and popular hike. Go up Tolman Creek road until the pavement ends. Right after the gate is a pull off on the right and the trail starts there. It goes along the contour line to the Ashland loop road and from there you can connect to miles and miles of trails.

properties.name: Top of Park St. Trail Access
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 Go up the steep, steep hill of Park street and you will be rewarded by access to miles, and miles, and miles of trails. Follow this trail and veer to the left when you get into the woods and you might just find a beautiful water fall. Go to the right, up the hill, and you will connect with trails that could take you to the summit of Mt. Ashland, or down the other side to Reeder reservoir. Wow.

properties.name: Tryon Creek State Park - Boones Ferry Rd entrance
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  This is a lesser known entrance to Tryon park that is most popular with dog walkers and runners. Coming from the north the entrance is on the left, right after the nursery. There is a map at the entrance and the trail connects to the West Horse loop, a nice easy hike.

properties.name: Tryon Creek State Park, Main Entrance
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 A beautiful park with tons of trails. From the main parking lot I really enjoy taking the dogs on the North Horse Loop. There are generally fewer hikers here so it is easier to let the dogs loose. The nature center has maps of all the trails in the park, and there are many!

properties.name: Tumalo Mountain
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05This is very popular as a backcountry ski area in the winter, but in the summer and fall it is a lovely hike. The top affords spectacular views of 3 Sisters and Bachelor. My dog is named after this peak.

properties.name: Wayside outside Denali Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  My friend and I had illegally camped on the side of the road the night before we were going to visit Denali. In the morning we poached bathrooms at a restaurant and a mob of little old ladies told me "terrorists bombed new york!" I was physically dragged into the bar to see the TV and remember seeing footage of the plane crashing into the tower. I ran outside laughing to tell my friend - laughing was all I could do, it seemed so absurd. We did what anyone would do, took a 60 mile bus ride into the Alaskan outback.

properties.name: Wellfleet Beach at Dusk
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  Late August of 2004 just before I left the Cape.

properties.name: Wild Goose Cafe and Bar
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 2365 Ashland St, Ashland ORGreat breakfasts, good food and great live music almost every night. My favorite bar in town :)

properties.name: Woods Memorial Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  One of the great little canyon parks in SW Portland. Access from Woods Parkway off 48th/45th and Taylors Ferry or neighborhood streets like Marigold and 43rd. A neighborhood group has been doing great restoration work here but it is still a little used hideaway.
